summary: This is an internal email chain from October 2019 within the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, discussing a request for data on victim interviews. The primary content is a response estimating that roughly 30 victim interviews in 2019 were driven by the Epstein investigation, highlighting its significant impact on the unit's workload.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney Human Trafficking Co-Coordinator
persons.role: Assistant United States Attorney, Human Trafficking Co-Coordinator
persons.context: The sender of the initial request for data on victim interviews from the Money Laundering & Transnational Criminal Enterprise Unit.

events.title: Epstein Investigation Victim Interviews
events.description: An estimate that roughly 30 victim interviews in 2019 were driven by the Epstein investigation, indicating significant investigative activity.

keyFacts: The email chain is an internal communication within the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York regarding data collection on victim interviews.
A response estimates that roughly 30 victim interviews in 2019 were driven by the Epstein investigation.
The request seeks the number of unique victims or potential victims of human trafficking interviewed in the past year, regardless of whether the case was charged.
The correspondence highlights the significant resource impact of the Epstein investigation on the Human Trafficking and Money Laundering units.
The document is dated October 2019, shortly after Jeffrey Epstein's death in August 2019, indicating ongoing investigative work.
